chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm
Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Claude A Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Court set restitution at zero.
Concurrent with: with count 2, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 148 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

09-22-15 / Rebecca F Dallet                   .
The Court ordered the JOC amended to state that the defendant is to have NO Contact with the victim unless approved by MBCA and Children's Court or his agent.                                                   

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim unless approved by MBCW and Children's Court.
No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.

Court advised defendant that voting rights are suspended.
Complete a course in anger management.
Attend parenting classes.
Mental Health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Claude A Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Claude A Harris in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, , concurrent with Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 10 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, , concurrent with Count 1, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 10 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by MBCW and Children's Court.
-No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
PLEA HEARING

AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  The 6/30/14 jury trial is vacated.  At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.

Defendant Claude A Harris in court with attorney Douglas E Batt.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended to Child Abuse, Recklessly Cause Great Bodily Harm, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(a), a Class Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
FINAL PRETRIAL
